title: Todayâ€™s very awkward handcuff stunt
text:
A HARMLESS prank has backfired spectacularly on Today Extra, leaving hosts Sonia Kruger and David Campbell forced to host the show this morning handcuffed together. 
Or so theyâ€™d have us believe. 
The pair first revealed the â€œprankâ€ during their regular pre-show preview on the Today set with Lisa Wilkinson and Karl Stefanovic. 
â€œThereâ€™s something weird going on over here,â€ Stefanovic remarked. 
Campbell claimed that they had taken part in what was supposed to be a â€œtwo-minute prankâ€ in which Kruger handcuffed herself to him because he was late to work. 
â€œWe thought itâ€™d be hilarious ... but weâ€™ve broken the key off in the lock,â€ Kruger wailed. . @SoniaKruger and @DavidCampbell73 's handcuff prank didn't exactly go to plan! ğŸ˜‚ #9Today pic.twitter.com/AgitkR1LvJ â€” The Today Show (@TheTodayShow) February 8, 2017 
While news.com.au is fairly sceptical that the pair really are chained together without any form of escape, the hosts have certainly committed to the gag. 
They reappeared â€” still attached â€” at the start of the show, and continued to lament their predicament throughout the rest of the morning. Whatâ€™s going on here? Source: Channel 9 
Kruger even complained Campbell wasnâ€™t able to control his bladder during their captivity â€” telling the visiting stars of Suits during their interview: â€œHe has been [to the toilet] ... and I was kind of outside.â€ 
Lovely.
